item.title: Germany still in credit crunch ‘danger’
item.description: The country is still at risk of a credit crunch as banks face a wave of corporate downgrades, the head of the country’s main banking association has warned

item.title: GM and Ebay to launch joint venture
item.description: Buyers of new cars will be able to haggle with dealers over the internet under a joint venture between General Motors and Ebay, to be launched in California on Tuesday

item.title: Yanzhou Coal in talks to buy Felix
item.description: China’s Yanzhou Coal Mining is in advanced talks to buy Felix Resources in a cash takeover bid that is expected to value the Australian coal mining group at about A$3.7bn

item.title: Wall Street slips after bullish week
item.description: US stocks drifted from last week’s highs with investors looking to bank profits, even as several closely-watched experts gave a relatively bullish analysis for the equity markets

item.title: Nortel results beat expectations
item.description: Nortel Networks, the Canadian telecommunications equipment maker operating under bankruptcy protection, reported better than expected second quarter results as the company moves ahead with the sale of its assets.

item.title: Banks make $38bn from overdraft fees
item.description: US banks stand to collect a record $38.5bn in fees for customer overdrafts this year, with the bulk of the revenue coming from the most financially stretched consumers amid the deepest recession since the 1930s, according to research

item.title: China says Rio spying has cost it $100bn
item.description: Beijing has accused mining group Anglo-Australian miner Rio Tinto of spying on its steel industry for six years, a move that indicates the detention of four Rio employees on accusations of stealing state secrets could be the start of a widening campaign rather than an isolated case

item.title: Crisis and climate force supply chain shift
item.description: Manufacturers are abandoning global supply chains for regional ones in a big shift brought about by the financial crisis and climate change concerns, according to executives and analysts

item.title: Bombs in Baghdad and northern Iraq kill 41
item.description: Bombs in Shia Muslim areas in Baghdad and northern Iraq killed 41 people, police said, the latest of several major attacks since US combat troops withdrew from urban centres in June

item.title: UK highlights threat to food security
item.description: Genetically modified crops could form be part of the solution for making British agriculture more self-sufficient, a minister conceded as the government launched a review of UK food security
